quote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burden of it to anyone else.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings—of which every man has many—not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one’s self.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: No one is useless in this world who makes it lighter for someone else.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The most important thing in life is to stop saying ‘I wish’ and start saying ‘I will.’
author: Charles Dickens

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: This is a world of action, and not for moping and droning in.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: We forge the chains we wear in life.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The men who learn endurance, are they who call the whole world, brother.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: It is a melancholy truth that even great men have their poor relations.
author: Charles Dickens
